actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handling missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)
test_df.drop(['Cabin'], axis=1, inplace=True)

# Encoding categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Splitting the dataset
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Scaling features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_scaled = scaler.transform(X_val)
test_df_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df[features])

# Training the model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Making predictions
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_scaled)

# Validation
accuracy = model.score(X_val_scaled, y_val)
print(f'Validation Accuracy: {accuracy}')

# Predicting on test set
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': model.predict(test_df_scaled)
})

submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handling missing values
X_train['Age'] = X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median())
test_df['Age'] = test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median())
test_df['Fare'] = test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median())

# Encoding categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Ensure both DataFrames have the same columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(test_df.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
test_df = test_df[common_columns]

# Splitting the dataset
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Scaling features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_scaled = scaler.transform(X_val)
test_df_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Training the model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Making predictions
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_scaled)

# Validation
accuracy = model.score(X_val_scaled, y_val)
print(f'Validation Accuracy: {accuracy}')

# Predicting on test set
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': model.predict(test_df_scaled)
})

submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handling missing values
X_train['Age'] = X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median())
test_df['Age'] = test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median())
test_df['Fare'] = test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median())

# Encoding categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Ensure both DataFrames have the same columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(test_df.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
test_df = test_df[common_columns]

# Add PassengerId column back to test_df
test_df['PassengerId'] = test_df.index + 892

# Splitting the dataset
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Scaling features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_scaled = scaler.transform(X_val)
test_df_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df)

# Training the model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Making predictions
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_scaled)

# Validation
accuracy = model.score(X_val_scaled, y_val)
print(f'Validation Accuracy: {accuracy}')

# Predicting on test set
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': model.predict(test_df_scaled)
})

submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Feature engineering
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X_train = train_df[features]
y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handling missing values
X_train['Age'] = X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median())
test_df['Age'] = test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median())
test_df['Fare'] = test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median())

# Encoding categorical variables
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'])

# Ensure both DataFrames have the same columns
common_columns = X_train.columns.intersection(test_df.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_columns]
test_df = test_df[common_columns]

# Add PassengerId column back to test_df
test_df['PassengerId'] = test_df.index + 892

# Splitting the dataset
X_train, X_val, y_train, y_val = train_test_split(X_train, y_train, test_size=0.2, random_state=42)

# Scaling features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_val_scaled = scaler.transform(X_val)
test_df_scaled = scaler.transform(test_df[common_columns])  # Ensure only common columns are scaled

# Training the model
model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=200)
model.fit(X_train_scaled, y_train)

# Making predictions
y_pred = model.predict(X_val_scaled)

# Validation
accuracy = model.score(X_val_scaled, y_val)
print(f'Validation Accuracy: {accuracy}')

# Predicting on test set
submission_df = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': model.predict(test_df_scaled)
})

submission_df.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
